title: Chat log misinterpreted - Perma Ban
body:
Just got a Permanent Ban, and upon reading my chat logs I beg of you to review my case.
There was little to none hard flame, toxic or negativity. I can see a couple of lines being misinterpreted as flaming but it actually wasn't. If you look at the replay of the games and time of words, you will understand. 

In the first game when I said "We hate Lee", let me give some context: my team mate Heca and I chased and suicided to kill the Lee and when questioned about it, in response as a joke I said "we hate (enemy) lee" I just meant we hate the champion I hardly see this as flame.

In game two, when I said "loool this swain", I was actually complimenting my team mate swain 1v3'ing and being an absolute monster, if you look at the time I wrote it and watch the replay of the game you will see this. When I say "fk this ali", I'm expressing my frustration at the enemy alistar always stopping me from getting kills, I am not flaming him in all chat.
I am very upset by this Permanent Ban when there is people in game wishing me cancer, all sorts of diseases and for me to kill my self; but I get a ban for this very weak chat log.

Please I beg of you, review my case.

You were passive/aggressive in those games.
You flamed your team for KS ( the most noob thing ever ).
The simple fact that someone reported you says it wasn't misinterpreted.
You can't know how someone feels when you say stuff that could be interpreted in multiple ways.
They are the ones who decide on that.
Considering this isn't your first punishment you should've known better.
After a 14 day ban you should thread carefully as you will be watched closely.
You made a mistake and got permad.
Hope you learn from this.

My friend the system misinterpreted my words as toxic, not my team mates as if you see my points I said and read the chat of my team mate they were saying the same thing about swain being a monster etc.

It wasn't misinterpreted. Your teammates reported you for your behavior.

You literally just got off a 14-day ban 12 hours before this, and went right back to harassing people in game.

You were warned about this behavior, and the system recognized the fact that you hadn't changed your behavior.

People report anyone for playing bad regardless of their behaviour. To say, I was harassing people when telling them to leave my lane or to engage is over the top. I know I am not the perfect player but it's unbelievable to get permanently banned for this. I urge you to reassess.

You're certainly welcome to open a support ticket, and have them look into it.

I'm just explaining to you what happened.

Are you not able to look into it? Don't you think the punishment doesn't fit the case? I understand the system has recognised misbehaviour, but I had hoped for a human review. 
Thanks for your reply.

> [{quoted}](name=RecognizeUrLord,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ghLwoEhH,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2017-02-24T19:44:50.626+0000)

Well, good thing they don't ban **everyone** that says stfu.
They do, however, ban people that were on their last chance to shape up and still decided that "stfu" was the right thing to say.

Something small like that may not be indicative of somebody being toxic, but it certainly can indicate a relapse of somebody that has been toxic in the past. And having that relapse 12 hours after being given your final chance is a very good indicator to somebody not taking their previous punishment(s) seriously enough.

As an analogy: Drinking a beer doesn't make you an alcoholic, but in most cases somebody with an alcohol problem drinking a beer means they either relapsed or never even quit.

After a 14-day ban, you are either on your best behaviour, or you're out. It has always been like that.
